definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to squeeze oneself up into (a crowded vehicle etc)
to smell of sth/to smell like sth

sentences.english: The branch or bud that is grafted is called the scion.
sentences.chinese: 嫁接上去的枝或芽被稱爲接穗。

sentences.english: He rode on, blood flowing from his side.
sentences.chinese: 他騎滅馬，陳血從腰部流上去。

sentences.english: They don't really look like white elephants.
sentences.chinese: 看上去並不真象一羣白象。

sentences.english: It looks like the drums in Drum Tower in Xi'An.
sentences.chinese: 它看上去很像西安鼓樓裏的鼓。

sentences.english: Despite the clouds, the Matterhorn still was a great piece of rock to look at.
sentences.chinese: 除了雲朵外，馬特宏峯看上去始終是塊壯觀的石頭。

sentences.english: It was after dark and I was nervous, so when he pulled up I immediately jumped in the car.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，我很緊張，看到車過來了就跳上去。

sentences.english: Sneaking out may seem like a real option in the heat of anger.
sentences.chinese: 盛怒之下，偷偷溜出去看上去似乎是真正的解決之道。

sentences.english: A broken wood bridge, looked like was damaged by the thunderstorm.
sentences.chinese: 一個斷裂的木橋，看上去象是被暴風雨沖垮的。

sentences.english: Your bags are on the way up to your room .
sentences.chinese: 您的行李正在送上去給您。

sentences.english: The result is a universe that now looks like a sponge.
sentences.chinese: 結果是如今的宇宙看上去就像一塊海綿。

sentences.english: Its on the 5th floor, you may take the escalator to.
sentences.chinese: 在五樓，你可以乘座電梯上去。

sentences.english: Police say Chin appeared fine when guards brought breakfast to his cell.
sentences.chinese: 警方稱陳在獄卒給他送早餐的時候看上去一切正常。

sentences.english: He got ahead by sucking off.
sentences.chinese: 他是靠吹吹拍拍爬上去的。

sentences.english: Oh，they look just like live cranes.
sentences.chinese: 哦，這些仙鶴看上去就像真的一樣。

sentences.english: Can you imagine how much smarter this is going to make you look?
sentences.chinese: 能想像這會讓你看上去比以前聰明瞭多少嗎？

sentences.english: Pablo looked at him through his bleary eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去目光呆滯，茫然若失。

definition: to come up/to approach/(verb complement indicating success)
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of

(after a verb) indicating the beginning and continuation of an action or a state/indicating an upward movement (e.g. after 站[zhan4])/indicating completion/(after a perception verb, e.g. 看[kan4]) expressing preliminary judgment/also pr. [qi3 lai5]
to stand up/to get up/also pr. [qi3 lai2]
to go down/to descend/to go on/to continue/(of a servant) to withdraw
(after a verb, indicates coming out, completion of an action, or ability to discern or detect)

to come down/(completed action marker)/(after verb of motion, indicates motion down and towards us, also fig.)/(indicates continuation from the past towards us)/to be harvested (of crops)/to be over (of a period of time)/to go among the masses (said of leaders)
the top/above/overhead/upwards/the top margin/above-mentioned/those higher up
